column1: Topic title: PAS  Rally on Shariah Bill to feature BN friendly

column8: http://www.themalaymailonline.com/malaysia...muslim-speakersKUALA LUMPUR, Feb 15 — Several non-Muslims friendly to the ruling Barisan Nasional (BN) government are expected to speak at a rally this Saturday in support of PAS' controversial Bill to strengthen the Shariah courts.The Opposition Islamist party’s information chief Nasrudin Hassan said the keynote speakers are from an organisation calling itself “Barisan Nasional Non-Muslim Penceramah Association” and “a Hindu organisation from Pahang”.“I want to stress that this rally is a gathering of the umat, be it Muslims or non-Muslims,” Nasrudin told reporters here.“This is the people's issue, a national issue, so as we stated from the beginning we open the gathering to all,” he added.The PAS leader is confident that the presence of the non-Muslims speakers will show to all naysayers that its bid to elevate the status of the Shariah courts with stronger punitive powers has the support of all races.PAS anticipates a turnout of 200,000 people for the gathering that will be held in the city centre this weekend.MORE TO COME
